text: - Hi, my name is Ron Wedel.

I'm a Senior Partner Solutions
Architect here at AWS.
With me today is Mitch Ivanicki,
who is a go-to market leader
for one of our AWS partners, MontyCloud.
Thanks for coming, Mitch.
- Thanks for having me, Ron.
- So, as I understand it,

MontyCloud helps really
ease the day two burden

on a lot of customers coming
from on-premises infrastructure
into native AWS Solutions

or MSPs who manage multiple
customer accounts on AWS.

- Yes, we believe that with
an events-driven architecture,
we're able to help customers of all size,

whether it's a single AWS
account, multiple organizations,
everything from, you know,
the starting size of SMB
to complicated enterprise infrastructures.

- Great, let's take a look
at the architecture here.
So walk us through, it looks like we have
either a customer with multiple accounts
or I imagine this could also be an MSP
who manages multiple accounts.

- Yes, and it could even
be the same customer,

depending on how they wanna
view their environment.

What we do at MontyCloud
and the bet we took

is that events are the
language of the cloud,

and being able to have an
event-driven architecture

powered by AWS and Lambda, we
can scale with our customers.
So what you're seeing here,
whether it's a customer's organization,
two customer organizations,
we are able to use a tenant structure
to interact with MontyCloud.
So with those tenants,

if we're thinking of a
managed service provider,

each of those could be
a different customer.

As an enterprise, it could
be different business lines,

it could be a company
that's just been acquired.
We really wanna have the flexibility

to help our customers put AWS
in their business context.

And by us being able to take
this events-driven approach,
we're integrating deeply with AWS services
like Systems Manager, Lambda, CloudTrail,
so customers can have a cloud center
of excellence in minutes.

- Great, that was gonna
be my next question,

'cause it looks here that we
have multiple services running
in each of our customer accounts.

And I wanted to ask you,
where do you get the data?
Where you pulling that from

as it gets ingested into
the MontyCloud solution?

- Absolutely, so when we
are deploying MontyCloud
into a customer's account,

we're deploying a cloud
formation template,

and in that cloud formation
template is an IAM role.
And with that IAM role,

we will leverage CloudTrail
and Systems Manager
in the end customer accounts
to take everything from inventory
to performing automation events.

- Awesome, so as you
ingest all of this data in,

it looks like you're
using a variety of Lambda

and other AWS services to
really help ease that operation

and optimization of the
customer's environment.
Are you leveraging any type
of generative AI in the solution?
- Yes, we are.

What we have been building
is our own copilot

built on Bedrock,
SageMaker, and OpenSearch.

And using that, we're
ingesting those events
from those customer accounts
and allowing us to provide insights.

So something that's a very
common use case for customers is,
why did my account go up last month?
Why did those costs increase?
And when we can easily come in and say,

"Hey, you spun up a new
database instance of RDS,

"you provisioned more EC2
behind an Auto Scaling group,"

those types of insights
using generative AI

have been making it a lot
easier for our customers
to perform cloud operations.
- So once you have that data,

whether it's from the
generative AI portion
or just your other system tools,

it looks like we're able
to notify our customer here
over here with a variety of outputs.
Can you just talk about that?

- Yes, so the beauty of an
events-driven architecture

is you have the flexibility
to respond to events.

So when an event is
ingested by MontyCloud,
you have a few different options.
One, you can take an action,
triggering a runbook, a Python script,
you can have it as a notification

going to a Slack, Teams,
email, text message,
or you can have it send a ticket off
to a PagerDuty or a Jira.
- Excellent.

So it really looks like you
cover the whole architecture

of your customer from
the variety of services,
multiple ways to ingest the data,
take that data,
turn it into actionable events
or actionable recommendations,
whether it's via your generative AI tools

or the other tools that
MontyCloud leverages

to really help take that edge
off the day two operations

for customers or MSPs
managing large enterprises.

- Yes.
- Awesome.

Well, Mitch, I really
appreciate you coming in

and giving us a rundown
of the architecture,
it's been great,

and I really see where the
value of this solution can help,
you know, invent and simplify
what our customers are doing today.

- Thank you. However
we can help customers.

- Thanks, and if you need
any more information,
have a look at the solution brief below.
Thank you.
